stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on polishing the overworld’s jungle-bridge section: fixing a one-frame penguin AI bug, replacing a disliked timed plane mission with a damage-based challenge, rebuilding a smoother 3D bridge, and prototyping a mixed 2D/3D forest backdrop while testing performance on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: A one-frame desync caused penguins to lag behind; Kaze investigated roll and jaw values before patching the AI.
The timed plane mission was scrapped and re-imagined as a damage-avoidance gauntlet that re-uses the Super Mario Land retro plane physics.
development_findings.quote: We're reworking this area here because it sucked… The goal will be to get to the end without taking as much damage instead of the time limit.

development_findings.summary: Quest 4 received its first full beta; core layout is solid but bugs and the plane mission were heavily criticized.
development_findings.quote: Beta test 1 of Quest 4 is done… the level overall seems decent except the bugs sucked and the plane mission sucked.

development_findings.summary: A ‘steppy’ 2D bridge was replaced with a curved 3D Bezier-based model; 3D bridges were chosen for visual quality.
development_findings.quote: Do you see how steppy this bridge is? I don't like it. This new bridge will be so much smoother.

development_findings.summary: Forest backdrop prototype: layered 2D tree walls plus inexpensive 3D half-trees; overdraw tested on real N64 (≈32–50 FPS) using FOSS64 to preview.
Implemented new rotor ambience using a custom sound-composer tool that now lets Badub author SFX directly.
development_findings.quote: With the sound composer I made, Badub is able to make sound effects.

development_findings.summary: New ‘trophy room’ overworld building will display collectable trophies; picking one reveals hints for the next two, inspired by Smash Brawl milestones.
development_findings.quote: You collect one trophy and you get two hints for the next two trophies.

development_findings.summary: Lighthouse decal bug: black backgrounds appear unless ‘write all’ is enabled; lighthouse color still incorrect and slated for fix.
Everdrive X7 currently fails to run the hack; issue might be on the mod side and is on Kaze’s fix list.
development_findings.quote: The X7 had an issue where it couldn't run my mod, but that might as well also be an issue in my mod.

development_findings.summary: Switched from GIMP to Photoshop for 16-color indexing after GIMP introduced dithering artifacts in tree textures.
development_findings.quote: I'm never indexing colors in GIMP again… that looks a million times better.

development_findings.summary: Kaze coded an in-engine neuro-evolution framework to train AI to play Mario 64 levels, built over the weekend.
development_findings.quote: I have a thing that can train an AI inside Mario 64 to play Mario 64.

context_findings.summary: Squarespace sponsorship funds a bi-weekly video cadence, indicating partial financial reliance on YouTube deals.
context_findings.quote: You better pray that Squarespace keeps paying up because as long as Squarespace pays I'm probably gonna make a video every two weeks.

context_findings.summary: Kaze professes having ‘no ego’ yet enjoys playful banter; stresses objective self-critique.
context_findings.quote: I have no ego at all. In fact, I can entirely objectively evaluate anyone's criticism of me.

context_findings.summary: Strong stance on tooling: any language with runtime overhead is ‘garbage’; believes only weak programmers debate languages.
context_findings.quote: The only people that care about which programming language you use are people that are not very good at programming.

context_findings.summary: Personal hobby of flipping Yu-Gi-Oh cards for profit reflects entrepreneurial streak.
context_findings.quote: I bought $80 of Yu-Gi-Oh cards… sold the rest for $230.

biobak.summary: Pitched the ‘trophy building’ concept and iterated with Kaze on how hints and display logic should work.
Provided feedback and anxiety about older level art; complimented new bridge; brainstormed tree/foliage approaches.

badub.summary: Now composes both music and in-game sound effects via Kaze’s new sound tool; rotor ambience was showcased.

zeina.summary: Created high-resolution (640×640) foliage textures that Kaze plans to down-res for N64 use.

key_stories.title: Plane Mission Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Testers hated the timed airplane section in Quest 4, so Kaze re-designed it into a damage-avoidance course while keeping the established plane physics.
key_stories.challenge: Timed mission felt unfun and tested poorly.
key_stories.process: Removed timer, kept physics, added environmental hazards that chip health.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze believes new version will be ‘a lot more fun’.
key_stories.key_quote: The goal will be to get to the end without taking as much damage instead of the time limit.

key_stories.title: Birth of the Trophy Room
key_stories.summary: During casual chat, Biobak suggested an overworld trophy gallery. Kaze expanded the idea into a milestone-hint system reminiscent of Smash Brawl.
key_stories.challenge: Need for engaging overworld buildings with replay value.
key_stories.process: Live brainstorm: empty slots, collected trophies light up, adjacent plaques give hints.
key_stories.outcome: Concept accepted for prototyping, but not 100 % confirmed.
key_stories.key_quote: You collect one trophy and you get two hints for the next two trophies.

key_stories.title: Forest Visuals Experiment
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggled to make a dense jungle look good without killing performance. He iterated between 2D walls, 3D half-trees, texture fixes, and real-hardware tests.
key_stories.challenge: Flat geometry looked ‘poopy’ and overdraw risked framerate drops.
key_stories.process: Layered approach, new textures, GIMP vs Photoshop indexing, FOSS64 previews, hardware FPS tests.
key_stories.outcome: Prototype accepted for now; needs varied tree models and color pass.
key_stories.key_quote: Honestly, on N64 this looks even more like a real forest… I think this passes as a forest.

key_stories.title: Sound Composer Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: A custom tool now lets Badub craft sound effects, demonstrated with rotor ambience that immediately made the level feel alive.
key_stories.challenge: Need for streamlined SFX creation without external tools.
key_stories.process: Kaze coded composer; Badub authored rotor loop; integrated into build.
key_stories.outcome: Team can generate bespoke sounds quickly going forward.
key_stories.key_quote: I added that recently. With the sound composer I made, Badub is able to make sound effects.

key_stories.title: Glass Wall Deaths in Quest 4
key_stories.summary: Beta testers repeatedly ran into an unseen glass pane and died, raising debate over whether to fix or treat as ‘skill issue’.
key_stories.process: Kaze weighs clarity vs player discovery; no fix yet.
key_stories.key_quote: The player did not see that there was glass blocking it… I'm not sure if that's something we should fix or if it's like, well, it's kind of a skill issue.

open_questions.context: Timed plane section replaced with damage-based version using same physics.
questions: What specific feedback convinced you to scrap the timer?
How will difficulty scale without a timer?
Any thematic reason for damage vs time?
Were team members consulted or was it a solo call?

open_questions.context: Biobak’s idea accepted conceptually; mechanics still fluid.
questions: What technical pipeline will display dynamic trophies?
Will trophies unlock tangible rewards or purely cosmetic?
How will hint text be balanced to avoid spoilers?
Who will model/animate the trophies?

open_questions.context: Kaze built weekend prototype to train AI in-engine.
questions: What motivated you to revisit AI after earlier attempt?
Any plans to turn this into dev-tool (e.g., automated playtesting)?
Performance impact on N64 or run only in emulator?
Could this AI teach enemies or NPCs behaviors?

open_questions.context: Tool now empowers Badub to add SFX.
questions: What features does the composer expose (loops, ADSR, reverb)?
How does it integrate with the decomp audio engine?
Has it changed the workflow or number of SFX produced?
Future plans for community-made sounds?

open_questions.context: Hack fails on X7; root cause unknown.
questions: Have you profiled why the mod fails (ROM size, CIC, DMA)?
Could this affect physical-cart release plans?
Any coordination with Krikzz or flash-cart makers?
Timeline for a fix?

open_questions.context: Layered 2D/3D forest achieves 32-50 FPS on hardware.
questions: What is the target framerate for release builds?
Any contingency if performance drops in later quests?
How will you vary tree models without blowing RSP/RDP budgets?
Do you profile on PAL and NTSC consoles?

open_questions.context: Testers die by unseen glass barrier.
questions: Will you add visual cues or redesign layout?
How do you balance challenge vs fairness?
Any internal guidelines for visibility of hazards?

open_questions.context: Squarespace funding drives video schedule and exposure.
questions: How does video production time compete with ROM-hack development?
Does sponsorship ever sway design priorities or release timing?
Is there pressure to showcase flashy features for views?
What happens if sponsorship ends mid-project?
